title: WCAG Basics üèõÔ∏è
ques: What is **WCAG**? Name the four core principles (POUR) that guide it.

answer.content:
*   **WCAG:** Web Content Accessibility Guidelines. It is the international standard for web accessibility.
*   **POUR:**
    1.  **P**erceivable (e.g., provide text alternatives for images)
    2.  **O**perable (e.g., keyboard functionality)
    3.  **U**nderstandable (e.g., readable text, predictable UI)
    4.  **R**obust (e.g., compatible with screen readers)

explanation: POUR is the foundation. If a site fails one of these (e.g., Operability), it is inaccessible to some users.

title: Alt Text for Images üñºÔ∏è
ques:
Writing good `alt` text is an art. For an image of a **magnifying glass** used as a search button, which `alt` text is best?
1.  `alt="image of a magnifying glass"`
2.  `alt="Search"`
3.  `alt=""`

answer.content:
Option 2: **`alt="Search"`**.
*   **Reason:** Alt text should describe the **function** of the image, not its visual appearance. A screen reader user doesn't care that it looks like a glass; they care that clicking it performs a search.

explanation: Context matters. If the image is purely decorative, use `alt=""` so screen readers skip it.

title: Keyboard Navigation ‚å®Ô∏è
ques: A user should be able to navigate your entire site using only the **Tab** key. What outline property should you **never** set to `none` (unless you provide a custom replacement)?

answer.content:
You should never set `outline: none` (or `outline: 0`) on focused elements without providing a replacement style.

This removes the **Focus Indicator** (the blue ring), making it impossible for keyboard users to know which element they are currently on.

explanation: #NoMouse challenge: Try using your site without a mouse. If you get lost, your focus management is broken.

title: Color Contrast üé®
ques: According to WCAG AA standards, what is the minimum contrast ratio for normal text against its background?

answer.content:
The minimum ratio is **4.5:1** for normal text. 
For large text (18pt+ or 14pt bold), it can be lower (**3:1**).

explanation: Low contrast text (like light gray on white) is unreadable for millions of people with low vision.

title: Skip Navigation Links ‚è≠Ô∏è
ques: What is a **"Skip to Content"** link and why is it vital for screen reader users?

answer.content: It is a hidden link (visible on focus) at the very top of the HTML. It allows users to **jump directly to the main content**, bypassing repetitive header links/menus on every page. Without it, a user might have to press Tab 50 times on every page just to read an article.

explanation: This is a huge quality-of-life feature for power keyboard users and screen reader users.
